title: Conservation of energy - change in internal energy

content.question: An astronaut on a space station throws a ball of diameter <math alttext="0.30 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.30</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> toward a wall. The ball travels in a straight line over a distance of <math alttext="1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> before colliding with the wall. Immediately before hitting the wall, the ball has kinetic energy <math alttext="1.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>. The wall exerts an average force of <math alttext="5.0 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> during the collision, after which the ball rebounds with kinetic energy <math alttext="1.0 joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>. By how much did the internal energy of the ball-wall system increase during the collision?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
